Diese Ungetüme verschlingen alles, was ihnen in den Weg kommt. Obwohl sie normalerweise Erde, Mineralien und gelegentlich auch Gebäude bevorzugen, fressen sie auch Lebewesen, Pflanzen und andere organische Materialien. Es gibt zahlreiche Arten von Höhlenwürmern, die alle eine andere Farbe haben und perfekt an ihre Umgebung angepasst sind. Höhlenwürmer übertreffen selten die Intelligenz eines typischen Tieres. Sie sind auch schlechte Eltern, die ein Gelege vorbereiten, das in einer Eiweißhülle eingeschlossen ist, bevor sie es verlassen. Nach einer kurzen Brutzeit schlüpfen die Jungen und bilden eine wimmelnde Masse gefräßiger Höhlenwurmlarven. Wenn sie sich der Reife nähern oder wenn sie keinen ausreichend nahrhaften Boden mehr vorfinden, gehen die Larven aufeinander los. Sie kämpfen um die Vorherrschaft oder fliehen, bis nur noch wenige übrig sind. Die Überlebenden wachsen schnell und werden zu Jungen Höhlenwürmern.

Abweichung der Brut

Die hier vorgestellten Höhlenwürmer sind typisch für normale Felsenwürmer. Verwende für Karmesinwürmer die Elite-Anpassung und füge Immunität gegen Feuer hinzu. Erhöhe bei den Azurwürmern ihre Bewegungsrate für Schwimmen auf 40 Fuß/12 m. Graue Würmer erhalten Leerenheilung und eine Schwäche gegen Vitalitätsschaden von 5. Alabasterwürmer erhalten Immunität gegen Kälte.

Frühzeitiges Schlüpfen

Ein einziges Höhlenwurmei kann mehrere tausend Larven produzieren, wenn es über Jahrtausende hinweg langsam heranreift. Wenn ein Höhlenwurmei jedoch gestört oder beschädigt wird, bevor sein natürlicher Zyklus abgeschlossen ist, tritt das Ei in ein schnelles Reifestadium ein. Nur ein paar hundert Würmer überleben diesen Prozess und erzeugen deutlich weniger Nachkommen als bei einer langsamen Reifung.

action->Relentless.name: Unnachgiebig
action->Relentless.description: Wenn ein Junger Höhlenwurm den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Gelähmt} oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Verlangsamt} erlangt, wird die Wirkungsdauer um die Hälfte reduziert (Minimum 1 Runde). Außerdem erholt er sich von Mali auf seine Bewegungsrate und dem Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Bewegungsunfähig} am Ende seines Zuges. Ferner ignoriert er nichtmagisches Schwieriges Gelände und behandelt Sehr Schwieriges Gelände wie Schwieriges Gelände.

action->Shake It Off.name: Effekt abschütteln
action->Shake It Off.description:
Auslöser Die Höhlenwurmlarvenbrut würde von einem Zustand oder einer negativen Auswirkung betroffen sein (z.B. Verfluchte Verwandlung)

Effekt Die Larvenbrut hebt den auslösenden Zustand oder Effekt auf. Effekte von Artefakten, Göttern oder einer ähnlich mächtigen Quelle können auf diese Weise nicht vermieden werden.

action->Ferocious Gnaw.name: Wildes Nagen
action->Ferocious Gnaw.description: Jeder Gegner innerhalb der Angriffsfläche der Larvenbrut nimmt @Damage[(6d6)[piercing]]{6W6 Stichschaden} (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic]{einfacher Reflexwurf}).

action->Pummeling Thrash.name: Wuchtiges Prügeln
action->Pummeling Thrash.description:
Anforderungen Die letzte Aktion der Larvenbrut war Wildes Nagen

Effekt Die Larvenbrut windet sich wild und versucht, ihre Beute zu verzehren. Die Larvenbrut legt einen Fertigkeitswurf für @Check[athletics|defense:reflex]{Athletik} ab und vergleicht das Ergebnis mit dem Reflex-SG jeder Kreatur in ihrer Angriffsfläche.

Kritischer Erfolg Die Kreatur erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Liegend} und nimmt @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]]{4W6 Wuchtschaden}.

Erfolg Die Kreatur erhält den Zustand Liegend und nimmt @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning]]{2W6 Wuchtschaden}.

Mist Projector Trap.name: Nebelwerfer
Mist Projector Trap.description: Aus versteckten Düsen quillt Gas, das rasch gefriert und nahen Büchern nur begrenzten Schaden zufügt.
Mist Projector Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:27]{Diebeskunst} (Experte), um die Falle ohne den benötigten Schlüssel zu deaktivieren; oder @Check[crafting|dc:26]{Handwerkskunst}, um eine Chemikalie zu mischen und anzuwenden, welche das Gas neutralisiert.

action->Icy Mist.name: Eisiger Nebel
action->Icy Mist.description:
Trigger The northeast bookshelf is touched

Effect Freezing mist fills a @Template[cone|distance:30] originating from the room's northeast corner. Creatures in the area take @Damage[5d8[cold]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic]). Creatures who fail or critically fail the saving throw take @Damage[2d8[persistent,cold]] damage for up to 3 rounds. The affected area is filled with mist that functions as obscuring mist for 3 rounds.

Mumkuh.name: Mumkuh
Mumkuh.publicNotes:
Die listigen Zombiefürsten befehligen ihre niederen Verwandten, die sie auf unerwartete Weise einsetzen können. Sie sind dafür bekannt, dass sie mit Intelligenten und Vertrockneten Zombies zusammenarbeiten und Zellen intelligenter Zombies schaffen, die sich in den Reihen der geistlosen Untoten verstecken.

Diese schlurfenden Untoten, die einfach zu erschaffen und vielseitig einsetzbar sind, werden oft wegen ihrer Stärke und endlosen Ausdauer für langweilige, sich wiederholende Aufgaben eingesetzt.

action->Unkillable.name: Nicht zu töten
action->Unkillable.description: Mumkuh ist nahezu unverwundbar. Sie verliert die Schwäche gegen Hiebschaden und erhält Resistenz gegen alle Schadensarten 3, aber auch Schwäche gegen Kritische Treffer 6.

action->Command Zombie.name: Zombie befehligen
action->Command Zombie.description:
Der Zombiefürst murmelt ein blasphemisches Lied, um die Kontrolle über einen Zombie zu erlangen, der sich im Umkreis von 100 Fuß/30 Metern befindet und den er sehen kann. Ein Zombie, der Geistlos ist und nicht unter der Kontrolle eines anderen steht, fällt automatisch unter seine Kontrolle; andernfalls kann der Zombie oder sein Beherrscher einen @Check[will|dc:22]{Willenswurf} ablegen, um zu verhindern, dass der Zombie kontrolliert wird (je nachdem, welcher der beiden den höheren Modifikator hat). Der Ziel-Zombie ist bei Erfolg vorübergehend für 24 Stunden immun gegen diese Fähigkeit. Der Versuch scheitert, wenn der Zombie die gleiche Stufe wie der Zombiefürst oder höher hat.

Der Zombie bleibt unter der Kontrolle des Zombiefürsten, bis einer von beiden zerstört wird. Ein Zombiefürst kann bis zu 8 Zombies auf einmal kontrollieren. Wenn der Zombiefürst eine Anzahl von Zombies kontrollieren würde, die diese Grenze überschreitet, wählt er aus, welche er freilässt.

action->Create Zombies.name: Zombies erschaffen
action->Create Zombies.description: Der Zombiefürst kann mit einem 1-stündigen Ritual kleinere Zombies erschaffen. Während dieser Zeit singt der Zombiefürst und vollführt einen unheiligen Tanz über den Leichen, die er zum Leben erwecken will. Im Gegensatz zu normalen Ritualen sind dafür keine Fertigkeitswürfe erforderlich und es entstehen keine Kosten. Am Ende dieser Stunde kann der Zombiefürst einen Zombie der Stufe 1 oder 2 oder zwei Zombies der Stufe 0 oder niedriger erschaffen. Diese stehen automatisch unter der Kontrolle des Zombiefürsten und werden auf das Limit von Zombies befehligen angerechnet. Alle Zombies, die der Zombiefürst erschafft, zählen immer noch normal zum Begegnungsbudget einer Begegnung.

action->Shamble Forth!.name: Voran!
action->Shamble Forth!.description:
Häufigkeit Einmal pro Runde

Effekt Jeder vom Zombiefürst kontrollierte Zombie nutzt die Aktion Laufen (oder Graben, Klettern, Fliegen oder Schwimmen, wenn er über die entsprechende Bewegungsart verfügt) um sich 5 Fuß/1,50 m fortzubewegen.

action->Zombie Commander.name: Zombiebefehlshaber
action->Zombie Commander.description: Mumkuh kann bis zu 16 Zombies zugleich kommandieren – genug für einen ganzen Schlurfertrupp.

spell->Blood Vendetta.requirements: Du bist in der Lage zu bluten

equipment->Religious Symbol.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.upzjwQ96cZG0Xlmx]
Religious Symbol

action->Inexorable.name: Unerbittlich
action->Inexorable.description: Wenn Narseigus einen der Zustände @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Betäubt}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Gelähmt} oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Verlangsamt} erhält, legt er einen @Check[flat|dc:15]{Einfachen Wurf} ab. Bei einem Erfolg ignoriert er den Zustand.

action->Shake It Off.name: Effekt abschütteln
action->Shake It Off.description:
Häufigkeit Einmal am Tag

Auslöser Narseigus erzielt bei einem Rettungswurf gegen einen Zustand oder widrigen Effekt (z. B. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dN8QBNuTiaBHCKUe]{Verfluchte Verwandlung) einen Fehlschlag oder Kritischen Fehlschlag.

Effekt Narseigus würfelt erneut für den auslösenden Rettungswurf und verwendet das bessere Ergebnis.

action->Quickened Casting.name: Schnelles Zauberwirken
action->Quickened Casting.description: Sollte Narseigus’ nächste Handlung das Wirken eines Spontanen Okkulten Zaubertricks oder eines Spontanen Okkulten Zaubers des 4. Grades oder niedriger sein, reduziert er die zum Wirken erforderliche Anzahl an Aktionen um 1 (Minimum 1 Aktion).

action->Steady Spellcasting.name: Standhaftes Zauberwirken
action->Steady Spellcasting.description: Sollte eine Reaktion Narseigus beim Zauberwirken unterbrechen, legt er einen @Check[flat|dc:15]{Einfachen Wurf} ab. Bei einem Erfolg wird seine Handlung nicht unterbrochen.

action->Worm Form.name: Wurmgestalt
action->Worm Form.description: Narseigus verwandelt seinen Unterkörper teilweise in den eines Höhlenwurms. Er kann seinen Waffenlosen Schwanzangriff und seine Bewegungsraten für Graben und Klettern nur einsetzen, wenn er diese Gestalt angenommen hat. Die Verwandlung hält 1 Minute lang an.

action->Worm's Feast.name: Festmahl der Würmer
action->Worm's Feast.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Narseigus calls forth a brood of infantile cave worms to feast on his enemy's flesh. One creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:27] save.

Critical Success The worms writhe away harmlessly.

Success The target takes @Damage[2d6[piercing],4d6[persistent,piercing]]{2d6 piercing damage and 4d6 persistent piercing} damage.

Failure The target takes @Damage[6d6[piercing],4d6[persistent,piercing]]{6d6 piercing damage and 4d6 persistent piercing} damage.

Critical Failure As failure, plus the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} as long as it takes persistent piercing damage.

Note: A DC for this ability was not provided by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature's level based on the Gamemastery Guide creature building rules

Offended Epitaphs.name: Beleidigte Nachrufe
Offended Epitaphs.description: Begräbnisinschriften und Nachrufe flackern und präsentieren unterschiedliche Botschaften; dies lässt Ahnengeister kurz erscheinen und sich beschweren, dass ihre Nachkommen sie vergessen hätten.
Offended Epitaphs.disable: Drei erfolgreiche Würfe für @Check[diplomacy|dc:20]{Diplomatie}, @Check[occultism|dc:20]{Okkultismus}, und/oder @Check[religion|dc:20]{Religion}, um die übellaunigen Geister fortzuschicken
Offended Epitaphs.routine: (2 Aktionen) Ahnengeister erscheinen in den Bereichen D1 und D2, jeder Geist verblasst nach mehreren Runden, wird aber durch einen anderen Geist ersetzt

action->Growing Grumbles.name: Wachsender Groll
action->Growing Grumbles.description:
Auslöser Eine Kreatur nähert sich Bereich D2 auf 10 Fuß/3 m oder weniger

Effekt Die Ahnengeister beginnen sich zu manifestieren und die Spukerscheinung würfelt ihre Initiative aus.

action->Lambast.name: Nervenaufreibendes Nörgeln
action->Lambast.description:
Ein Geist brüllt eine lebende Kreatur an und zwingt sie zu einem @Check[will|dc:18]{Willenswurf}:

Erfolg Die Kreatur ist nicht betroffen.

Fehlschlag Die Kreatur erleidet @Damage[2[persistent,mental]]{2 Punkte Anhaltenden Mentalen Schaden}. Solange dieser Anhaltende Schaden besteht, kann die Kreatur geisterhafte Inschriften auf Zwergisch ein kleines Stück vor verschiedenen, über den Park verteilten Nachrufen schweben sehen.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Wie beim Fehlschlag, aber die Kreatur erleidet @Damage[4[persistent,mental]]{4 Punkte Anhaltenden Mentalen Schaden} und erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Benommen 1}, bis der Anhaltende Schaden endet.

Ornery Augdunars.name: Übellaunige Agundare
Ornery Augdunars.description: Erschrockene Augdunare galoppieren wild auf der Koppel umher und beißen und treten dabei um sich.
Ornery Augdunars.disable: Erfolg bei vier der folgenden Würfe in beliebiger Kombination: @Check[nature|dc:14]{Naturkunde} (Geübt), um die Tiere zu beruhigen; @Check[intimidation|dc:16]{Einschüchtern} (Ungeübt), um die Augdunare in die Flucht zu treiben; @Check[will|dc:18]{Willenswurf} (Geübt), um nicht wegzuzucken und Selbstbewusstsein auszustrahlen, so dass die Augdunare die SC meiden. Pro Erfolg erhält die Gefahr einen kumulativen Malus von -1 auf ihre Angriffswürfe.
Ornery Augdunars.routine: (2 Aktionen) Die Augdunare nutzen eine Aktion, um einen Bissangriff auszuführen, und eine andere Aktion für einen Wurf zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Zu Fall bringen} gegen ein anderes Ziel ([/r 1d20+9]]{+9}). Sollten die Augdunare seit ihrem letzten Zug Schaden erlitten haben, nutzen sie stattdessen als erste Aktion Peitschende Hufe und führen mit der zweiten Aktion einen Bissangriff oder einen Wurf zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Zu Fall bringen} aus.

action->Rile.name: Reizen
action->Rile.description:
Auslöser Algerschmick würfelt ihre Initiative aus

Effekt Die Augdunare würfeln ihre Initiative aus.

action->Lashing Hooves.name: Peitschende Hufe
action->Lashing Hooves.description: Ein Augdunar führt einen Hufangriff aus und vergleicht das Ergebnis des Angriffswurfes mit der RK von bis zu zwei zueinander angrenzenden Gegnern.

Plague Zombie.name: Verseuchter Zombie
Plague Zombie.publicNotes:
Verseuchte Zombies sind mit widerwärtigen, ansteckenden Krankheiten infiziert.

Das einzige Verlangen eines Zombies ist es, alles Lebende zu verzehren. Die unaufhaltsam torkelnden und zum Denken unfähigen Boten des Todes lassen sich nur aufhalten, wenn sie vollständig zerstört werden.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Biss
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Anforderungen Der Zombie hat eine Kreatur @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Gegriffen} oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Gebunden}.

action->Slow.name: Langsam
action->Slow.description: Ein Zombie besitzt permanent den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Verlangsamt 1} und kann keine Reaktionen nutzen.

action->Zombie Rot.name: Zombiefäule
action->Zombie Rot.description:
Eine infizierte Kreatur kann den durch Zombiefäule erlittenen Schaden nicht heilen, bevor sie nicht von der Krankheit geheilt wurde.

Rettungswurf @Check[fortitude|dc:18]{Zähigkeitswurf}

Phase 1 Erkrankt ohne negative Auswirkungen (1 Tag)

Phase 2 @Damage[1d6[void]]{1W6 Punkte Leerenschaden} (1 Tag)

Phase 3 @Damage[1d6[void]]{1W6 Punkte Leerenschaden} (1 Tag)

Phase 4 @Damage[1d6[void]]{1W6 Punkte Leerenschaden} (1 Tag)

Phase 5 Tod; erhebt sich augenblicklich als Verseuchter Zombie wieder.

Redcap Cavalry.name: Rotkappenkavallerie
Redcap Cavalry.publicNotes:
Wer auch immer sich ausgedacht hat, ein Feenwesen mit einem blutgetränkten Hut auf ein riesiges, blutgieriges Insekt zu setzen, hatte sicherlich einen gewissen Sinn für Humor, aber das hielt die Rotkappen nicht davon ab, riesige Blutmücken zu zähmen und zu trainieren. Obwohl Königin Frilogarma eine fliegende Kavallerie anstrebte, erfand ihr Hof versehentlich das Rotkappenrennen. Bei diesem Sport wird eine Rotkappe mit einer frisch getränkten Kappe von einem riesigen Arm um eine Rennstrecke geschwungen, während mehrere andere Rotkappen auf riesigen Blutmücken hinterherfliegen. Die „Köder“-Rotkappe überlebt in der Regel nicht, aber sie steht für etwa zwei Minuten im Mittelpunkt der Aufmerksamkeit.

Im Ätherhof trainieren die Rotkappen das Reiten auf riesigen Blutmücken, die speziell als Reittiere gezüchtet wurden. Während ihre Feenvettern außerhalb der Stadt dies als Torheit ansehen, betrachten die Rotkappen vom Hof das Reiten von Blutmücken als edlen Sport.

Die Rote Kappe

Selbst wenn eine Rotkappe keinen Anhaltenden Blutungsschaden erleidet, tropfen ihre roten Kappen blutrot, getränkt vom Blut ihrer Feinde. Das ist mehr als genug, um Kreaturen zu provozieren, die stark auf den Geruch von Blut reagieren. Kreaturen mit Geruchssinn behandeln eine Rotkappe wie eine Kreatur, die Anhaltenden Blutungsschaden erleidet.

action->Not My Cap!.name: Not My Cap!
action->Not My Cap!.description:
Trigger Their bloodseeker mount fails their blood-crazed flat check

Requirements the redcap is mounted on a giant bloodseeker

Effect The bloodseeker may reroll the flat check.

action->Red Cap.name: Red Cap
action->Red Cap.description:
A redcap's woolen hat is dyed with the blood of its victims. If the redcap loses its cap, it no longer benefits from fast healing and takes a –4 status penalty to its damage rolls. It can create a new cap in 10 minutes, but that cap doesn't grant its powers until the redcap has turned it red with Blood Soak. A cap has no benefit for creatures other than the redcap who made it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.s5mS7CyE0oOYlecv]{Effect: Lost Red Cap}

action->Divine Revulsion.name: Divine Revulsion
action->Divine Revulsion.description:
Sieht eine Rotkappe eine Kreatur, welche ein religiöses Symbol einer guten Gottheit mit einer Aktion der Kategorie Interagieren präsentiert oder es nutzt, um einen göttlichen Zauber zu wirken, so muss die Rotkappe einen @Check[will|dc:21]{Willenswurf} ablegen. Im Anschluss ist sie gegen den Anblick aller präsentierten göttlichen Symbole für 10 Minuten immun.

Kritischer Erfolg Die Rotkappe ist nicht betroffen.

Erfolg Die Rotkappe erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Verängstigt 2}.

Fehlschlag Die Rotkappe erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Verängstigt 4} und für 1 Runde den Zustand@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fliehend}.

action->Blood Soak.name: Blood Soak
action->Blood Soak.description:
The redcap dips its cap in the blood of a slain foe. The foe must have died in the last minute, and the redcap must have helped kill it. The redcap gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wPIGBcpCqCWgrCiq]{Effect: Blood Soak}

action->Flyby Swing.name: Flyby Swing
action->Flyby Swing.description:
Trigger The recap's bloodseeker mount moves away from a creature within the redcap's reach

Requirements The redcap is mounted on a giant bloodseeker

Effect The redcap Strikes the creature with their scythe.

Repelling Surge.name: Repelling Surge
Repelling Surge.description: A shockwave of energy surges out from the room's center.
Repelling Surge.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:29] (expert) to fool the wards, DC 31 Thievery (master) to disable the wards, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 28) to counteract the wards

action->Repel.name: Repel
action->Repel.description:
Trigger A creature that isn't a Rivethun practitioner enters the room

Effect The trap deals @Damage[(5d4+12)[force]] damage to the triggering creature (@Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save). On a failed save, they're additionally knocked back 10 feet.

Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap.name: Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap
Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap.description: A 10-foot-long, 5-foot-thick column of stone thuds to the ground, just in front of the bridge. It immediately starts to roll down the bridge, quickly picking up speed.
Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:25] check to create a wedge to immobilize the column, @Check[athletics|dc:21] check to immobilize the column until the end of the creature's next turn, a creature can Climb over an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} column with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:18] check.
Rolling Stone Cylinder Trap.routine: (1 action) The rolling stone cylinder trap uses Crushing Roll.

action->Drop and Roll.name: Drop and Roll
action->Drop and Roll.description:
A lever at the top of the south tower is pulled

Effect A thick column of stone drops from above the gate, then uses crushing roll. The rolling stone cylinder trap rolls initiative.

action->Crushing Roll.name: Crushing Roll
action->Crushing Roll.description:
Requirements The rolling stone cylinder is not @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}

Effect The rolling stone cylinder trap moves its Speed west along the bridge. Creatures it moves past or lands on take @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage and are forced to move west to the first available space (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic]). Creatures who critically succeed at the Reflex save are not damaged but are still moved west. If the rolling stone tries to move into a non-creature obstruction, such as a wall or barricade, it deals bludgeoning damage to the obstruction and only continues moving if the obstruction is destroyed, otherwise the trap stops.

Shambler Troop.name: Shambler Troop
Shambler Troop.publicNotes:
This shuffling mass of decaying flesh moves with dull but singular focus.

Necromancers most often create these mindless undead as obedient, expendable servitors. Left to its own devices, a zombie seeks only to consume the living, stopping only when its rotting body can no longer hold together.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A shambler troop is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Troop Defenses.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.RJbI07QSiYp0SF9A]

Thresholds 60 (12 squares), 30 (8 squares)

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.TroopDefenses]

action->Grave Tide.name: Grave Tide
action->Grave Tide.description: The shambler troop is less organized than most troops. It can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into its spaces. Its spaces are difficult terrain to other creatures.

action->Putrid Stench.name: Putrid Stench
action->Putrid Stench.description: 15 feet. The zombies' rotting flesh is particularly malodorous. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:19] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all zombies' putrid stenches for 1 minute.

action->Shambling Onslaught.name: Shambling Onslaught
action->Shambling Onslaught.description:
1 to 2

Frequency once per round

Effect The shamblers lash out at any enemies in their squares or within @Template[emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save). The damage depends on the number of actions.

1 @Damage[(2d6+5)[bludgeoning]] damage

2 @Damage[(2d6+9)[bludgeoning]] damage

action->Troop Movement.name: Truppbewegung
action->Troop Movement.description: Whenever a troop Strides, it first Forms Up as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to its Speed. This works just like a Gargantuan creature moving; for instance, if any square of the troop enters difficult terrain, the extra movement cost applies to the whole troop.

Skibrellon.name: Skibrellon
Skibrellon.publicNotes:
Leshy creations sometimes fall prey to herbivores and foragers. Whereas most take the loss in stride, fungus leshies sometimes grow bitter and explore the grimmer elements of fungi: decomposition and possession. Combining unethical experiments, mind-altering cordyceps spores, and occult magic fueled by their own victim narrative, a fungus leshy can transform into a hyphae tyrant, who in turn transforms corpses into sporeborn puppets to torment local fauna. These leshies' greatest tragedy is perhaps their own impermanence. As their agendas increasingly celebrate decay, a hyphae tyrant's spite and occult narrative slowly drain their life force, ultimately ending in a final burst of destructive energy.

Troubled Reincarnation

Typically, a leshy's spirit wanders the natural world after death, eventually inhabiting a new leshy body. It's unclear whether a hyphae tyrant's spirit can ever become a new leshy. It's speculated that they eventually become natural haunts, transform into oni, or even fade forever unless found and redeemed.

spell->Create Mycoguardian.name: Create Mycoguardian
spell->Create Mycoguardian.description:
To create a mycoguardian, such as a sporeborn, a ritualist can perform a ritual similar to create undead (Pathfinder Core Rulebook 411) called create mycoguardian, but providing valuable parasitic fungal spores instead of black onyx. This ritual uses Fungus Lore (trained) or Nature (expert) for both the Primary Check and Secondary Checks, and lacks the Evil trait.

You transform the target into an undead creature with a level up to that allowed in Table 7-1. There are many versions of this ritual, each specific to a particular type of undead (one ritual for all zombies, one for skeletons, one for ghouls, and so on), and the rituals that create rare undead are also rare. Some forms of undead, such as liches, form using their own unique methods and can't be created with a version of create undead.

Table 7-1: Creatures Creation Rituals

Creature Level Spell Rank Required Cost
-1 or 0 2 15 gp
1 2 60 gp
2 3 105 gp
3 3 180 gp
4 4 300 gp
5 4 480 gp
6 5 750 gp
7 5 1,080 gp
8 6 1,500 gp
9 6 2,100 gp
10 7 3,000 gp
11 7 4,200 gp
12 8 6,000 gp
13 8 9,000 gp
14 9 13,500 gp
15 9 19,500 gp
16 10 30,000 gp
17 10 45,000 gp

Critical Success The target becomes an undead creature of the appropriate type. If it's at least 4 levels lower than you, you can make it a minion. This gives it the minion trait, meaning it can use 2 actions when you command it, and commanding it is a single action that has the auditory and concentrate traits. You can have a maximum of four minions under your control. If it's intelligent and doesn't become a minion, the undead is helpful to you for awakening it, though it's still a horrid and evil creature. If it's unintelligent and doesn't become a minion, you can give it one simple command. It pursues that goal single-mindedly, ignoring any of your subsequent commands.

Success As critical success, except an intelligent undead that doesn't become your minion is only friendly to you, and an unintelligent undead that doesn't become your minion leaves you alone unless you attack it. It marauds the local area rather than following your command.

Failure You fail to create the undead.

Critical Failure You create the undead, but its soul, tortured by your foul necromancy, is full of nothing but hatred for you. It attempts to destroy you.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Tanzende Lichter
spell->Dancing Lights.description: Du erschaffst bis zu vier schwebende Lichter in einem Abstand von nicht mehr als 10 Fuß/3 Meter voneinander. Jedes erhellt seine Umgebung wie eine @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.8Jdw4yAzWYylGePS]{Fackel}. Erhältst du den Zauber aufrecht, darfst du eine beliebige Anzahl der Lichter bis zu 60 Fuß/18 Meter weit bewegen. Dabei muss jedes Licht innerhalb von 120 Fuß/36 Metern Reichweite von dir und innerhalb von 10 Fuß/3 Metern von den anderen Lichtern bleiben. Ansonsten erlischt es.

spell->Protector Tree (Creates Fungus).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.K9gI08enGtmih5X1]
Protector Tree (Creates Fungus)

weapon->Spore Shephard's Staff.name: Spore Shephard's Staff
weapon->Spore Shephard's Staff.description:
This staff is constructed from a magically grown amanita mushroom, with a shaft that spreads into a bright red cap speckled in white. While wielding the staff you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Nature checks to identify fungus.

Activate Cast a Spell

Effect You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

  • Cantrip @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.D7ZEhTNIDWDLC2J4]{Puff of Poison}
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.K9gI08enGtmih5X1]{Protector Tree} (resembles giant mushroom, not a tree), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jSRAyd57kd4WZ4yE]{Summon Plant or Fungus} (fungus only)

Craft Requirements Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

action->Sporesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.name: Sporesense (Imprecise) 60 feet
action->Sporesense (Imprecise) 60 feet.description: A hyphae tyrant intuitively senses and tracks all nearby fungi. The sense can distinguish between fungus creatures, features made of fungus, and creatures covered in spores.

action->Spore Burst.name: Spore Burst
action->Spore Burst.description: When a hyphae tyrant dies, a burst of primal energy explodes from its body in a @Template[emanation|distance:30], restoring 3d8 to each fungus creature and dealing @Damage[3d8[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:20]{basic Fortitude} save) to each non-fungus creature in the area. This area is filled with fungus, becoming difficult terrain.

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

The hyphae tyrant transforms into a Small fungus. This ability otherwise uses the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.dileJ0Yxqg76LMvu]{One with Plants}.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
action->Spore Cloud.description: A hyphae tyrant unleashes a cloud of spores in a @Template[emanation|distance:20]. Each non-fungi creature in this area must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save or take @Damage[2[persistent,poison]] damage. A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet (or 10 feet on a critical failure).

action->Spores.name: Spores
action->Spores.description: A creature that takes damage from a hyphae tyrant's spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability.

Slime Puppeteer.name: Schleimpuppenspieler
Slime Puppeteer.publicNotes:
Schon früh versuchten die Alghollthu, die intelligenten Kreaturen Golarions zu kontrollieren, und erschufen die Ungothol, um sie mit Informationen zu versorgen. Diese mit Schleim bedeckten Kreaturen infiltrierten humanoide Siedlungen und übermittelten ihren Herren Informationen mit Hilfe mächtiger Telepathie. Im Laufe der Jahrhunderte erwiesen sich die Schleimpuppenspieler gegenüber den vielseitigeren Gesichtslosen als unterlegen.

Schleimpuppenspieler tarnen sich als ihre humanoide Mahlzeit. Sie umhüllen ihr Ziel und töten es, dann werden die Haut des Puppenspielers und die Haut der Leiche gallertartig und verschmelzen miteinander. Die Gestalt des Puppenspielers ersetzt die äußere Schicht des Körpers der Leiche, während sich lange, drahtige Ranken in das Nervensystem der Leiche einnisten. Das Ergebnis ist eine fast perfekte Kopie der toten Kreatur, die nun von dem finsteren Alghollthu-Agenten von innen heraus kontrolliert wird. Der Schleimpuppenspieler kann mit der Stimme der toten Kreatur sprechen, allerdings ohne die Sprache oder Erinnerungen der ursprünglichen Kreatur.

Die Alghollthu, die Jahrtausende lang über Golarion herrschten, erschufen mit Hilfe von Folterprozessen und Magie zahlreiche abscheuliche Kreaturen, von denen viele überlebt haben.

Verschiedene Puppenspieler

Der Schleimpuppenspieler ist nur ein Versuch, einen irdischen Spion zu erschaffen; die Alghollthu haben unzählige weitere erschaffen. Es ist schwer zu sagen, wie viele ihrer Art bis in die heutige Zeit überlebt haben. Einige Schleimpuppenspieler tauschten ihre Empfindlichkeit gegenüber heißen Umgebungen gegen Kälte ein. Andere wurden massiv vergrößert und zielten auf verschiedene Gesellschaften der Riesen. Es gibt sogar Gerüchte über Elementare Schleimpuppenspieler, die die Elementarebenen infiltrieren können, aber bisher wurden anerkannten Gelehrten noch keine handfesten Beweise vorgelegt.

action->Telepathic Bond.name: Telepathisches Band
action->Telepathic Bond.description: Ein Schleimpuppenspieler unterhält eine starke telepathische Verbindung mit dem Alghollthu, der ihn erschaffen hat. Diese Verbindung hat eine planetare Reichweite, aber der Puppenspieler ist blind und taub, während er diese Verbindung nutzt.

action->Stinky Sweat.name: Stinkender Schweiß
action->Stinky Sweat.description: 10 Fuß/3 m. Wenn ein Schleimpuppenspieler Feuerschaden erleidet, bildet er eine Schicht aus stinkendem Schleim auf seiner Haut, die bleibt, bis sie abgewaschen wird. Solange die Schicht vorhanden ist, müssen an den Schleimpuppenspieler angrenzende Kreaturen einen @Check[fortitude|dc:24]{Zähigkeitswurf} ablegen. Bei einem Fehlschlag erhält die Kreatur den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Kränkelnd 1}. Eine Kreatur, die den Rettungswurf erfolgreich besteht, ist 1 Minute lang immun gegen den Schweiß des Puppenspielers.

action->Envelop.name: Einhüllen
action->Envelop.description: Der Puppenspieler wickelt seinen Körper um ein benachbartes Ziel (@Check[reflex|dc:24]{Reflexwurf}; keine Wirkung). Das Ziel erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Gebunden} und der Puppenspieler den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Bewegungsunfähig}. Der Puppenspieler kann nur Schwanzangriffe gegen die Gebundene Kreatur ausführen und kann nur eine einzige mittlere oder große Kreatur einhüllen. Der Puppenspieler kann das Einhüllen als freie Aktion beenden.

action->Mimic Form.name: Gestalt nachahmen
action->Mimic Form.description: Der Puppenspieler kann die Gestalt eines Leichnams annehmen, den er Eingehüllt hat. Das dauert eine Stunde. Während dieser Zeit kann er sich weder bewegen noch angreifen und hat eine RK von 16. Sobald der Puppenspieler die Form des Ziels angenommen hat, kann er seine Fähigkeit Einhüllen sowie die Bewegungsraten für Fliegen und Schwimmen nicht mehr einsetzen, bis Gestalt nachahmen endet. Der Puppenspieler hat nur Zugriff auf seinen Flügelangriff, solange er Gestalt nachahmen benutzt. Der Puppenspieler kann Gestalt nachahmen als Aktivität mit drei Aktionen der Kategorie Handhaben beenden.

Soulbound Doll (Sky King's Tomb).name: Soulbound Doll (Sky King's Tomb)
Soulbound Doll (Sky King's Tomb).languages: one spoken by its creator (typically common)
Soulbound Doll (Sky King's Tomb).publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

spell->Light.target: 1 Gegenstand von maximal 1 Last, den entweder niemand oder du oder ein bereitwilliger Verbündeter mit sich führt

action->Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
action->Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of its donor soul's personality, though none of that creature's memories. This causes a soulbound doll to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits.

Soulbound Mauler (Chaotic Evil).name: Soulbound Mauler (Chaotic Evil)
Soulbound Mauler (Chaotic Evil).languages: one spoken by its creator (typically common)
Soulbound Mauler (Chaotic Evil).publicNotes:
If a soulbound doll isn't large and strong enough for one's needs, there's the oversized soulbound mauler. An upgrade to the soulbound doll, this mannequin is powered by the entire soul of a sapient creature. Many a necromancer has attempted to use these constructs as a method to live forever, likely as a shortcut around the complicated and ultimately morbid path to lichdom. However, the soul within the mannequin has problems properly expressing itself and displays rudimentary control over the host, often resulting in childlike behavior anywhere from curious to sadistic.

Rather than embedding the soul focus gem in the construct's neck or chest, it's tethered by bands of ectoplasm within an exposed chamber on the mannequin's chest. Until the soulbound mauler is destroyed, the focus gem cannot be removed from the empty cavity in its chest. However, the gem can be displaced which causes the soulbound mauler significant anguish, not only damaging the connection between the gem and artificial body, but also impairing the construct's ability to function.

Innate Spells

Like a soulbound doll, a soulbound mauler gains an additional 3rd-rank innate spell depending on its alignment, as listed below.

Lawful Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}

Neutral Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump}

Chaotic Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste}

Lawful Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness}

Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.I0j56TNRmGcTyoqJ]{Shared Invisibility}

Chaotic Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter}

Lawful Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow}

Neutral Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GKpEcy9WId6NJvtx]{Stinking Cloud}

Chaotic Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}

action->Personality Cage.name: Personality Cage
action->Personality Cage.description: A soulbound mauler encapsulates an entire soul within its soul focus gem, with that soul's personality and past shining through along with a confusing mix of fragmented memories and instincts. This causes a soulbound mauler to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits. When the mauler doesn't have a soul bound, it's inanimate.

action->Eager Rend.name: Eager Rend
action->Eager Rend.description:
The soulbound mauler has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The soulbound mauler holds the creature it has grabbed and attempts to tear it in two. That creature takes @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage (basic @Check[fortitude|dc:18]). On a critical failure, the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

action->Tethered Soul.name: Tethered Soul
action->Tethered Soul.description: The soul focus gem that powers a soulbound mauler is tethered with eight ectoplasmic leashes inside an open cavity in the creature's chest. It can be targeted directly with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} action. Rather than the normal result of these actions, the soulbound mauler takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} on a success; on a critical success, it takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Rather than the normal result of these actions, the soulbound mauler takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} on a success; on a critical success, it takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Soulbound Mauler (Lawful Evil).name: Soulbound Mauler (Lawful Evil)
Soulbound Mauler (Lawful Evil).languages: one spoken by its creator (typically common)
Soulbound Mauler (Lawful Evil).publicNotes:
If a soulbound doll isn't large and strong enough for one's needs, there's the oversized soulbound mauler. An upgrade to the soulbound doll, this mannequin is powered by the entire soul of a sapient creature. Many a necromancer has attempted to use these constructs as a method to live forever, likely as a shortcut around the complicated and ultimately morbid path to lichdom. However, the soul within the mannequin has problems properly expressing itself and displays rudimentary control over the host, often resulting in childlike behavior anywhere from curious to sadistic.

Rather than embedding the soul focus gem in the construct's neck or chest, it's tethered by bands of ectoplasm within an exposed chamber on the mannequin's chest. Until the soulbound mauler is destroyed, the focus gem cannot be removed from the empty cavity in its chest. However, the gem can be displaced which causes the soulbound mauler significant anguish, not only damaging the connection between the gem and artificial body, but also impairing the construct's ability to function.

Innate Spells

Like a soulbound doll, a soulbound mauler gains an additional 3rd-rank innate spell depending on its alignment, as listed below.

Lawful Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal}

Neutral Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump}

Chaotic Good: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o6YCGx4lycsYpww4]{Haste}

Lawful Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VosLNn2M8S7JH67D]{Blindness}

Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.I0j56TNRmGcTyoqJ]{Shared Invisibility}

Chaotic Neutral: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter}

Lawful Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]{Slow}

Neutral Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GKpEcy9WId6NJvtx]{Stinking Cloud}

Chaotic Evil: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}

action->Personality Cage.name: Personality Cage
action->Personality Cage.description: A soulbound mauler encapsulates an entire soul within its soul focus gem, with that soul's personality and past shining through along with a confusing mix of fragmented memories and instincts. This causes a soulbound mauler to match the donor soul's alignment and gain the corresponding alignment traits. When the mauler doesn't have a soul bound, it's inanimate.

action->Eager Rend.name: Eager Rend
action->Eager Rend.description:
The soulbound mauler has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Effect The soulbound mauler holds the creature it has grabbed and attempts to tear it in two. That creature takes @Damage[5d6[bludgeoning]] damage (basic @Check[fortitude|dc:18]). On a critical failure, the target also becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Spitter Pods.name: Spitter Pods
Spitter Pods.description: Specialized spore pods burst open, expel toxic globules, and recharge from alchemical reservoirs.
Spitter Pods.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:18] to add disruptive chemicals to the fungus's reservoir, @Check[nature|dc:18] (trained) to recognize how to constrict the chemicals' flow, or @Check[deception|dc:20] (trained) to spread spores that befuddle the fungus; three total successes are required to disable the trap.
Spitter Pods.routine: (3 actions) The spitter pods alternate between making Strikes and Reloading. The pods lose 1 action for each successful check to disable the trap.

action->Unfurl.name: Entrollen
action->Unfurl.description:
A non-fungus creatures enters area E4

Effect The spitter pod rolls initiative.

Sporeborn Myceloid.name: Sporeborn Myceloid
Sporeborn Myceloid.publicNotes:
While most sporeborn are created from the flesh of vertebrates or creatures with exoskeletons, fungal and plant creatures serve as a fine host for a sporeborn's parasitic spores. In these cases, the sporeborn mycelial network burrows through the corpse, replacing the original hyphae in fungal creatures and the xylem and pith in plants. This allows the sporeborn to puppet the creature, much as it does in mammals by replacing the tendons with its own rugged mycelium. Fungus and plant hosts are more likely to develop the potent poison sporeborn ability to enhance the hosts' natural abilities.

When a mindless guardian is needed, but the ethical bounds of creating undead are too uncouth, ritual casters may turn to a more fungal solution by creating a mycoguardian. Using valuable parasitic fungal spores, a ritualist may seed the corpse of a creature and encourage them to grow, sending mycelium tendrils throughout the body. The tendrils bond to mobile tissue such as bones, while replacing tendons with reinforced mycelium. This ritual magically replicates the yellow musk creepers' ability to spread throughout a dead organism then mobilize its body. But rather than a completely mindless fungal carrier, the ritualist has some control over the infested creature's behavior.

The magic of the ritual includes basic instructions and rules that guide the new fungal mycoguardian (in this case, a sporeborn). Simple instructions like "guard this room" or "slay all of the tiny creatures in this basement" should work well enough, but complex commands such as "deliver this letter to the Harbormaster of Caliphas" are doomed to failure.

Fungel Ristualists

While mycoguardians are rare, several different types of primal spellcasters might create a mycoguardian. Druids might turn the bodies of a poacher's victim against the poacher, seeking to avenge the wrongful death and rebalance the scales of life. Leshy spellcasters create mycoguardians to protect their hidden communities and sacred groves. The fey of Northern Fangwood transform fallen or rotted trees into crustoreal mycoguardians, massive arboreal-looking creatures covered in parasitic lichen. These lumbering sentinels patrol their borders, crushing all non-fey who dare approach. There are rumors of crustoreals being imbued with void energy from the Gravelands and going berserk.

Creating Mycoguardians

To create a mycoguardian, such as a sporeborn, a ritualist can perform a ritual similar to create undead (Pathfinder Core Rulebook 411) called create mycoguardian, but providing valuable parasitic fungal spores instead of black onyx. This ritual uses Fungus Lore (trained) or Nature (expert) for both the Primary Check and Secondary Checks, and lacks the Evil trait.

Different Mycoguardians

In addition to the sporeborn presented here, there are many versions of the create mycoguardian ritual for making mycoguardians other than sporeborn, such as for aquatic chytridions and so on. Some forms of mycoguardians, such as mycelial mindbores, come to be using their own unique methods and can't be created with a version of create mycoguardian.

action->Rancid Spore Pods.name: Rancid Spore Pods
action->Rancid Spore Pods.description:
The sporeborn is covered in spore pods that rupture when it takes any piercing damage or a critical hit. In either case, adjacent creatures are hit with spores, causing them to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless they succeed at a Fortitude save.

@Check[fortitude|dc:18] save.

action->Spore Pop.name: Spore Pop
action->Spore Pop.description: If a sporeborn myceloid is reduced to 0 HP by a critical hit, it pops, forcing it to immediately Emit Spores, even if it has already used the ability that day.

action->Emit Spores.name: Emit Spores
action->Emit Spores.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The sporeborn myceloid expels spores in a @Template[burst|distance:10] centered on a corner of its own space. This cloud lasts until the start of the sporeborn myceloid's next turn. Each creature that is in the cloud or enters it is exposed to purple pox.

action->Purple Pox.name: Purple Pox
action->Purple Pox.description:
Myceloids are immune

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:22];

Onset 1 minute

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[6d6[poison]] damage, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}, and the creature is compelled to seek out the nearest myceloid colony—this compulsion is a mental and emotion effect (1 day)

Stage 3 The creature dies. Over 24 hours, its corpse becomes bloated and bursts, releasing a new, fully grown myceloid

action->Spore Domination.name: Spore Domination
action->Spore Domination.description:
The sporeborn myceloid targets one creature affected by purple pox within 60 feet. That creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save. It is then temporarily immune to spore domination for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success Until the end of its next turn, the target is helpful to sporeborn myceloids and can't take hostile actions against them.

Failure As success, but for 1 minute.

Critical Failure As success, but until the purple pox is cured.

Sporeborn Sheep.name: Sporeborn Sheep
Sporeborn Sheep.publicNotes:
Plague zombies are infested with hideous contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

action->Headless.name: Headless
action->Headless.description: A headless spore sheep can't make Jaws attacks.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Wasting Wheeze.name: Wasting Wheeze
action->Wasting Wheeze.description:
Frequency once per [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Wasting Wheeze]] rounds

Trigger The headless spore sheep takes a critical hit or is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The headless spore sheep exhales a cloud of spores through its neck. Adjacent living creatures take @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} unless they succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save.

action->Zombie Rot.name: Zombie Rot
action->Zombie Rot.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 3 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately

Sporeborn Skull.name: Sporeborn Skull
Sporeborn Skull.publicNotes:
More dangerous than simple severed heads, these skulls are wreathed in unearthly flames.

Beheaded are the reanimated heads of decapitation victims. These mindless undead fly through the air or roll around to attack their prey.

action->Spore Explosion.name: Spore Explosion
action->Spore Explosion.description: When destroyed, a sporeborn skull explodes in a blast of bone and toxic spores that deals @Damage[1d6[piercing],1d6[poison]]{1d6 piercing damage plus 1d6 poison} damage to each adjacent creature (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save).

action->Stir the Spores.name: Stir the Spores
action->Stir the Spores.description:
Frequency once per [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Stir the Spores]] rounds

Trigger The sporeborn skull takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage

Effect The impact scatters spores onto all creatures within 5 feet, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Check[fortitude|dc:18] negates).

Stonemaker.name: Stonemaker
Stonemaker.publicNotes:
The basilisk is an eight-legged reptile with a nasty disposition and the ability to turn creatures to stone with its gaze. Folklore holds that, much like for the cockatrice, the first basilisks hatched from leathery eggs laid by snakes and incubated by roosters, but little in the basilisk's physiology lends any credence to this claim.

A basilisk prefers to eat petrified flesh. Once a victim has been turned to stone, the basilisk crunches the fossilized corpse with its powerful jaws and lets its potent stomach acids do the rest. This digestive process is extremely slow and inefficient, causing the basilisk to move so lethargically that it appears as if in mid-petrification itself. This has even led to the saying "as slow as a well-fed basilisk." Certainly basilisks are well-known for their slow gait and slothful nature, but a predator that can turn its prey to stone with a glance hardly has much need for speed.

An adult basilisk is 13 feet long from head to tail and weighs roughly 300 pounds. These reptiles make hissing sounds when moving about that turns to a guttural gurgle when they're agitated. Though they are normally solitary creatures that come together only to mate and lay eggs, there are periodic reports of regions being infested with unusual numbers of basilisks. What causes these unusual congregations of basilisk activity is unknown.

For unknown reasons, weasels and ferrets are immune to the basilisk's stare, and they sometimes sneak into basilisk lairs while a parent is hunting in order to consume eggs or freshly hatched young. Some legends suggest that a basilisk's blood can transmute common stones into other material, but this is likely a case of witnesses misinterpreting the magical restoration of previously petrified creatures or body parts.
Stonemaker.saveDetails: +2 status to saves vs. xulgath stench

action->+2 Status to Saves Vs. Xulgath S.name: +2 Status to Saves Vs. Xulgath Stench

action->Ferret Fear.name: Frettchenfurcht
action->Ferret Fear.description: Steinmacher fürchtet instinktiv Marderartige wie Wiesel, Frettchen oder auch Feuerfrettchen. Auf solche Kreaturen reagiert er, als besäßen diese die Fähigkeit @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]{Unheimliche Ausstrahlung} (@Check[will|dc:20|traits:emotion,fear,mental,action:frightful-presence]{Willenswurf}).

action->Petrifying Glance.name: Verlangsamender Blick
action->Petrifying Glance.description:
30 Fuß/9 m.

Auslöser Eine Kreatur innerhalb von 30 Fuß/9 m Entfernung, welche der Basilisk sehen kann, beginnt ihren Zug

Effekt Das Ziel muss einen @Check[fortitude|dc:20]{Zähigkeitswurf} ablegen; bei Misslingen erhält die Kreatur für 1 Minute den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Verlangsamt 1}, da sich ihr Körper versteift.

action->Petrifying Gaze.name: Versteinernder Blick
action->Petrifying Gaze.description:
Der Basilisk starrt eine maximal 30 Fuß/9 m weit entfernte Kreatur an, welche er sehen kann. Die Kreatur muss einen @Check[fortitude|dc:22]{Zähigkeitswurf} ablegen. Sollte der Rettungswurf misslingen und die Kreatur noch nicht durch Verlangsamender Blick oder diese Fähigkeit den Zustand Verlangsamt erhalten haben, erhält sie den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Verlangsamt 1}. Sollte die Kreatur bereits durch Verlangsamender Blick oder diese Fähigkeit den Zustand Verlangsamt erhalten haben, erhält sie bei einem Fehlschlag permanent den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Versteinert}.

Sollte eine derart versteinerte Kreatur mit dem frischen Blut eines maximal 1 Stunde toten Basilisken bestrichen (und nicht nur bespritzt) werden, wird sie augenblicklich entsteinert.

Ein Basilisk enthält genug Blut, um [[/br 1d3]]{1W3 Mittelgroße Kreaturen} auf diese Weise zu bestreichen.

Stoneriver.name: Steinfluss
Stoneriver.publicNotes:
Steinfluss ist ein Diener von Torag und ähnelt einem Schuppentier mit leuchtend blauen Augen und messingfarbenen, runenbedeckten Schuppen. Steinfluss gräbt sich durch den Mantel und die Kruste von Golarion und jagt unterirdische Scheusale, hilft tugendhaften Gemeinschaften und verteidigt heilige Stätten, wobei er oft mit Zwergen zusammenarbeitet.

Die fünf von Schmiedeherz

Steinfluss hat im Laufe der Jahre zahlreiche Kinder gezeugt, die alle klug, mutig und kühn sind. Fünf von ihnen haben sich zusammengetan, um das Böse als Team zu bekämpfen. Sie nennen sich die Fünf von Schmiedeherz und wollen genauso tugendhaft und heldenhaft sein wie ihr Vater. Bis jetzt waren ihre Methoden eher auffällig als effektiv.

spell->Light.target: 1 Gegenstand von maximal 1 Last, den entweder niemand oder du oder ein bereitwilliger Verbündeter mit sich führt

action->Bolster Torag's Chosen.name: Torags Auserwählte stärken
action->Bolster Torag's Chosen.description: 20 Fuß/6m. Zwerge und Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich, die Torag verehren, erhalten einen Zustandsbonus von +1 auf RK und Willenswürfe.

action->Devour Magic.name: Magie verzehren
action->Devour Magic.description: Immer wenn Steinfluss mit Verschlingen Schaden zufügt, verzehrt er einen der magischen Effekte der verschlungenen Kreatur wie @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Magie bannen} mit einem @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.E4Q7EiSG18sIvFwg]{Entgegenwirken}-Modifikator von [[/r 1d20+21 #Entgegenwirken]]{+21}.

action->Measure Soul.name: Seele abwägen
action->Measure Soul.description: Stoneriver mentally pries through the mind of a creature within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[10d8[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:29|basic] save). Stoneriver can choose to make this damage nonlethal or choose not to damage the creature at all. For 1 minute, Stoneriver gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and Perception checks against that creature. If the creature is evil and it failed its save, the creature is additionally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} on a critical failure). Stoneriver can't use Measure Soul again for 1d4 rounds.

action->Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
action->Rock Tunneler.description: Stoneriver can burrow through solid stone, leaving behind a tunnel if he desires.

Toilforged Sentinel.name: Toilforged Sentinel
Toilforged Sentinel.publicNotes:
Toilforged sentinels are intelligent war machines painstakingly constructed from iron, steel, and other metals over the course of a full year. With twin treads, a central cage filled with eternal flames, and numerous weapons (including a hammer, cannon, and grasping claw capable of snatching up foes), a toilforged sentinel is an intimidating sight. Creatures consumed by a sentinel's flames become captives, their souls eternally bound to the flames, powering the device. Such souls are freed upon the sentinel's destruction.

Salvation

Toilforged sentinels are religious constructs created to destroy heretics: those who refuse to worship Droskar. They take orders only from the clergy of Droskar and find particular satisfaction from consuming worshippers of Torag and other dwarven deities.

action->Find the Faithless (Imprecise) 6.name: Find the Faithless (Imprecise) 60 Feet
action->Find the Faithless (Imprecise) 6.description: The toilforged sentinel detects the presence of creatures that don't worship Droskar within 60 feet as an imprecise sense.

action->Exertion Aura.name: Exertion Aura
action->Exertion Aura.description: 20 feet. A toilforged sentinel saps the energy of nearby creatures. Each round a living creature begins its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save. On a failure, the creature takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage (@Damage[2d6[mental]]{2d6} on a critical failure) and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. This fatigue ends as soon as the creature remains outside of the aura for 1 minute.

action->Vulnerability to Exorcism.name: Vulnerability to Exorcism
action->Vulnerability to Exorcism.description: When a toilforged sentinel fails a saving throw against a spell that would banish tormented spirits or manipulate souls, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW]{Banishment} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}, instead of experiencing the listed effect, it takes 10 damage per spell rank.

action->Droskar's Grasp.name: Droskar's Grasp
action->Droskar's Grasp.description: The toilforged sentinel can Grab a creature using only one hand. It can move normally with a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} in its claw, carrying the creature along. If it has a creature grabbed in this way, it can't use its claw Strike. It activates Swallow Whole with its claw by depositing a grabbed creature into its soul furnace.

action->Soul Furnace.name: Soul Furnace
action->Soul Furnace.description: The toilforged sentinel has a cage incorporated into its central body, filled with profane fire and called a soul furnace. As long as a toilforged sentinels' soul furnace contains a living creature, the toilforged sentinel is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} (Stride or Strike).

Ulat-Kini Initiate.name: Ulat-Kini Initiate
Ulat-Kini Initiate.publicNotes:
Several groups of ulat-kinis have rediscovered the ancient way of kirtanang, a martial art from that uses broad, flowing motions of the claws.

Ulat-Kini Culture

The creatures who surface humanoids consider scum still hold grand empires beneath the waves. While some ulat-kinis still revere the alghollthu who created them and others have learned to hate their creators, there are ulat-kinis who have found a new way forward. They have developed their own culture outside of alghollthu influence, founding new underwater traditions and creating new cultural standards.

action->Flurry of Claws.name: Flurry of Claws
action->Flurry of Claws.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The ulat-kini initiate makes two claw Strikes against a single target.

action->Kirtanang.name: Kirtanang
action->Kirtanang.description: The initiate's Strikes take no penalty from passing through water.

Ulat-Kini Mindreaver.name: Ulat-Kini Mindreaver
Ulat-Kini Mindreaver.publicNotes:
When not being controlled and manipulated by alghollthus, ulat-kinis have found they can develop formidable psychic powers. Those who master this craft are dubbed "mindreavers" by their awestruck kin.

Ulat-Kini Culture

The creatures who surface humanoids consider scum still hold grand empires beneath the waves. While some ulat-kinis still revere the alghollthu who created them and others have learned to hate their creators, there are ulat-kinis who have found a new way forward. They have developed their own culture outside of alghollthu influence, founding new underwater traditions and creating new cultural standards.

spell->Blood Vendetta.requirements: Du bist in der Lage zu bluten

action->Psychic Daze.name: Psychic Daze
action->Psychic Daze.description:
The mindreaver targets one creature within 120 feet and violently intrudes into their mind. The target attempts a @Check[will|dc:22] save.

Critical Success The target creature is unaffected.

Success The target creature gains weakness 1 to mental damage for 1 minute. If they already have weakness to mental damage, the value of the weakness increases by one.

Failure The target creature takes 2d10 mental damage and gains weakness 1 to mental damage for 1 minute. If they already have weakness to mental damage, the value of the weakness increases by one.

Critical Failure As failure, except the target's weakness to mental damage increases by 2.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wEFRo8enunRLFsVE]{Effect: Psychic Daze}

action->Riled by Disrespect.name: Riled by Disrespect
action->Riled by Disrespect.description: An ancestral echo gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saving throw DCs against any creature that has not performed at least one task to beautify the site to which the echo is bound. This apples to any PC who didn't succeed at one or more skill checks to clean area D2.

action->Site Bound.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]

The ancestral echo can't leave the upper crypt.

A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Wiederkehr
action->Rejuvenation.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]

Restoring the vandalized inscriptions and reciting their corrected stories ushers these spirits back to the afterlife.

When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed. A ghost can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

Unbreakable Sorrow.name: Unbreakable Sorrow
Unbreakable Sorrow.description: The PCs hear the sound of sobbing and feel an overwhelming sense of sorrow, as if they'd lost something more precious to them than their own life.
Unbreakable Sorrow.disable: @Check[deception|dc:32] or @Check[performance|dc:32] (master) to laugh away the sadness, @Check[occultism|dc:31] (expert) to banish the psychic imprint, @Check[thievery|dc:33] (master) to disperse the emotional energy

action->Mourn.name: Mourn
action->Mourn.description:
Trigger A living creature approaches the statue

Effect The trap deals @Damage[(4d10+14)[mental]] damage to all creatures in the room (@Check[will|dc:28|basic] save). On a failed save, a creature additionally falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and begins to weep, taking @Damage[1d10[persistent,mental]] damage.

Unfeeling Empath.name: Unfeeling Empath
Unfeeling Empath.publicNotes:
The soul of a gnome killed by tragedy sometimes becomes so entangled in conflicting emotions that it becomes trapped and reanimates its own corpse. Known as unfeeling empaths, these undead wander in search of others' emotions. When they find thinking prey, they relentlessly goad that creature to elicit and consume their feelings. Though initially harmless, feeding drives an unfeeling empath into an expressive frenzy as they overload the victim's mind, resuming their senses only after their prey is dead.

Misery Loves Company

Unfeeling empaths appreciate any companions who can endure their outbursts. Lost souls and beings who prey on emotions sometimes adopt an unfeeling empath out of solidarity or because the undead gnomes are easy to torment. Thus, where these creatures appear, a sakhil, will-o'-wisp, or ghost is often nearby.

action->Empathic Sense (Precise) 60 feet.name: Empathic Sense (Precise) 60 feet
action->Empathic Sense (Precise) 60 feet.description: The unfeeling empath perceives all creatures affected by an emotion effect at the listed range.

action->Emotional Extremes.name: Emotional Extremes
action->Emotional Extremes.description: If a creature rolls a success at a check to affect an unfeeling empath with an emotion effect, the creature gets a critical success instead. If a creature rolls a failure to affect an unfeeling empath with an emotion effect, the creature gets a critical failure instead. Likewise, when an unfeeling empath rolls a success at a Will save against an emotion effect, it gets a critical success instead. When a unfeeling empath rolls a failure at a Will save against an emotion effect, it gets a critical failure instead.

action->Cathartic Howl.name: Cathartic Howl
action->Cathartic Howl.description:
Requirements The unfeeling empath is under an emotion effect

Effect The unfeeling empath attempts to counteract the emotion effect, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+11 #Counteract]]{+11}. It then howls, projecting those emotions in a @Template[cone|distance:15] (or a @Template[cone|distance:30] if the unfeeling empath successfully counteracted the emotion effect). Creatures in the area take @Damage[2d8[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:18|basic] save). A creature that critically fails this saving throw also takes [[/r 1d4[mental,persistent]]] damage.

action->Drink Emotions.name: Drink Emotions
action->Drink Emotions.description:
Requirements An enemy is under an emotion effect within 20 feet of the unfeeling empath

Effect The unfeeling empath regains [[/r 1d4[healing]]] Hit Points and becomes emotionally excited for 3 rounds. While excited, the unfeeling empath takes a –1 penalty to AC, gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, and deals an additional @Damage[1d4[mental]] damage with its melee Strikes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.wL4QI1h4YvdHoOuG]{Effect: Drink Emotions}

action->Goad.name: Goad
action->Goad.description:
The unfeeling empath floods a creature within 30 feet with countless memories and sensations. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:18] save.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of the unfeeling empath's next turn.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Tanzende Lichter
spell->Dancing Lights.description: Du erschaffst bis zu vier schwebende Lichter in einem Abstand von nicht mehr als 10 Fuß/3 Meter voneinander. Jedes erhellt seine Umgebung wie eine @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.8Jdw4yAzWYylGePS]{Fackel}. Erhältst du den Zauber aufrecht, darfst du eine beliebige Anzahl der Lichter bis zu 60 Fuß/18 Meter weit bewegen. Dabei muss jedes Licht innerhalb von 120 Fuß/36 Metern Reichweite von dir und innerhalb von 10 Fuß/3 Metern von den anderen Lichtern bleiben. Ansonsten erlischt es.

equipment->Avernal Cape.name: Avernal Cape
equipment->Avernal Cape.description:
Made from preserved crimson worm hide, this thick leather cape can deflect incoming blows without serious damage. It functions as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.DA3HgyEBGEbtRNOo]{Dueling Cape} and while moved into a protective position, it also grants you fire resistance equal to twice the relic's number of gifts.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7dLsA9PAb5ij7Bc6]{Effect: Dueling Cape}
equipment->Avernal Cape.gmNote:
Aspects beast, fire

Forming the Bond While wearing the cape, you defeat a foe and spare their life.

Advancing the Bond Befriend beasts and terrify foes with your physical presence and prowess.

Minor Gifts feral claws, flare bolt, heat haze

Major Gifts form of fury (snake form), searing wave

Voxnia.name: Voxnia
Voxnia.publicNotes:
Dark nagas are wicked, jealous creatures that crave power and wealth. Indeed, the dark naga sees such ideals as spiritual expressions of an essential truth: if one can take something, that something is theirs to have. The dark naga sees other creatures as lessers worthy only of subjugation or as rivals who must be eliminated.

Dark nagas dwell in remote places other creatures have forsaken, searching abandoned ruins for wealth and potent magic items. Those unlucky trespassers into a dark naga's lair typically find themselves as the naga's slaves or playthings, put to sleep with the monster's poison or incinerated by its deadly magic. Some dark nagas are more disposed toward socializing than others; in these cases, they may become wicked despots who rule over enclaves of captive or unsuspecting subjects. Subtler dark nagas, especially those who crave finer luxuries, dwell in or under the wealthy settlements and use their wiles to garner a decadent following, forming something akin to a cult with the naga as the jewelry-bedecked object of worship.

Nagas are serpentine beings with magical powers and keen, nearly inscrutable intellects. Physically, they resemble massive snakes with eerie visages that resemble those of humans. Nagas use their innate magic and poisonous fangs to keep all but the most stalwart foes at bay. Beyond the natural weapons they use to ward away foes, little is understood of the naga's unsettling physiology.

Nagas are intelligent creatures with powerful needs to pursue, be they the accumulation of knowledge, the collection of rare art, or the rule of an entire nation. On Golarion, the nation of Nagajor is one such society-an entire empire ruled by nagas and populated by reptilian humanoids who serve their naga rulers with a patriotic pride that borders on worship.

Still, most adventurers interact with nagas on a much smaller scale, encountering them as dangerous guardians in remote locations or not-so-abandoned ruins. In many cases, these nagas have heard of distant Nagajor, but they are usually unwilling to abandon their own pursuits to seek out a land where they might be worshipped as gods.

action->Guarded Thoughts.name: Guarded Thoughts
action->Guarded Thoughts.description: Dark nagas are immune to any form of mind reading.

action->Dark Naga Venom.name: Dark Naga Venom
action->Dark Naga Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:25]

Maximum Duration 5 minutes

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up ([[/br 1d4+1 #minutes]]{1d4+1 minutes})

Xulgath Ravening.name: Xulgath Ravening
Xulgath Ravening.publicNotes:
Strength and hunger drive most xulgath societies, reinforced by the tenets of their abyssal patron Zevgavizeb. A powerful leader can seize control of a xulgath community and direct their followers to fight as a unit, but formation fighting isn't something most xulgaths practice. This mob mentality often results in overzealous warriors tripping over or even biting each other. Suitably, these mobs have earned the name "ravenings," a term also used when describing Zevgavizeb's carnivorous rampages and referring to the millennia of xulgath infighting and social decline.

The Power of Suggestion

Xulgath ravening are most common in clutches controlled by spiritual leaders using some combination of cult behavior, group ritual, and even a little enchantment magic. By convincing participants that they're possessed by Zevgavizeb or a similar force, the leader then identifies a target and hopes for the best. Instilling secular doubt or incapacitating the leader can shatter a ravening's focus, causing its members to scatter or even turn on their leader.

action->Stench.name: Stench
action->Stench.description:
30 feet. A creature that enters the area must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, the creature also takes a –5 status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. While within the aura, the creature takes a –2 circumstance penalty to saves to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all xulgaths stenches for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.uB3CVn3momZO9h0L]{Effect: Xulgath Stench}
